resources.string:
Managing risk comes from the enterprise’s need to share information and protect resources from unauthorized use. 

Protecting information from unauthorized is only one of the concerns, however. 

Physical forms such as fires, floods, and earthquakes should be taken into consideration as well. 

Including security and privacy in an EA program helps to mitigate these risks in all areas of the enterprise. 

The physical security that should be reflected in the Security and Privacy plan are controls for the facilities that support IT processing, 

control of access to buildings, equipment, networks, telecommunication rooms, fire protection, media storage, and disaster recovery systems. 

There are a number of strategies in enforcing this security. 

For instance, building security may require a physical wall surround the building’s area. 

The requirements of physical security will be different between organizations.
